attributes.comment:
To whom it may concern:

It is well documented that the international adoption process be very costly and
time consuming. The cost to apply for families is currently $545.00 with additional
finger printing, documentation, and administrative costs. We believe a rise in costs
for this process puts an unjust financial burden on families already making a
significant financial commitment to the international adoption process.
Additionally, the emotional strain of waiting for an international adoption to go
through does not need the added stress financial of issues.

Families willing to provide a loving home to an orphan deserve to have the process
run as smoothly and as economically as possible. It is the least we can do for
those who are willing to make such a commitment.

Therefore, a raise in the costs for international adoption is unacceptable and
should be stopped.

Thanks for your consideration,

Larry and Jennifer Shell
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Larry Shell
